dcterms:creator: Tsung-Yi Lin
Michael Maire
Serge Belongie
et al.
dcterms:description: The COCO dataset is used as an out-of-distribution (OoD) proxy, containing images of objects captured in everyday scenes, which helps in improving the detection of unknown objects in semantic segmentation.
dcterms:title: COCO

dcterms:creator: Marius Cordts
Mohamed Omran
Sebastian Ramos
et al.
dcterms:description: The Cityscapes dataset is used for training the segmentation model, providing pixel-annotated urban street scene images for semantic segmentation tasks.
dcterms:title: Cityscapes

dcterms:creator: Peter Pinggera
Sebastian Ramos
Stefan Gehrig
Uwe Franke
Carsten Rother
Rudolf Mester
dcterms:description: The LostAndFound dataset is used to evaluate the pixel-wise out-of-distribution detection performance, containing images with annotations of road and small obstacles.
dcterms:title: LostAndFound

dcterms:creator: Hermann Blum
Paul-Edouard Sarlin
Juan Nieto
et al.
dcterms:description: The Fishyscapes dataset is used for evaluating the performance of semantic segmentation models in detecting out-of-distribution objects, containing images with annotated anomalous objects.
dcterms:title: Fishyscapes

dcterms:creator: Mark Everingham
S. M. Ali Eslami
Luc Van Gool
et al.
dcterms:description: The Pascal VOC dataset is referenced for its retrospective challenge in visual object classes, providing a benchmark for evaluating object detection and segmentation tasks.
dcterms:title: Pascal VOC
